flawed_nl_solution:
Ian is able to earn $18 per hour doing surveys. If he worked 8 hours doing surveys, then he earned $18*8 = $<<18*8=144>>144
If he spent half of what he earned, then he spent $144 * 50% = $<<144*50*0.01=27>>27
If Ian spent $27 of his earnings, then he has $144 - $27 = $<<27=27>>27 left

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 72.0, not 27.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
